result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A. Fliess

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Richard A. Fliess in court. Attorney Grant Ian Henderson not in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
NO RECORD: DE has been here in courtroom since 10:30 am and it now 11:16 am. ADA Huber advises the Court that Attorney Henderson emailed him this morning stating he has tested positive for covid and is requesting an adjournment. Court will adjourn. Clerk to email Attorney Henderson new date.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard A. Fliess
Current: LKA 4777 88th Avenue, c/o Kenosha County Detention Center, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 04-28-2022)
Prior: 4777 88th Avenue, c/o Kenosha County Detention Center, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States
Rotation letter returned in mail.  Returned from the United Postal Service. Refused.  Return to sender.  Not in Custody.

02:04 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Richard A. Fliess, appeared with Attorney Natalie Probst for Attorney Grant Ian Henderson.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. The parties state the matter is not resolved and are requesting an adjournment to continue to discuss resolution. Court adjourns. DE updates his address and phone number on the record.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard A. Fliess
Current: 4515 18th Street, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 4777 88th Avenue, c/o Kenosha County Detention Center, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court with Defendant Richard A. Fliess who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU  
  Minutes:  DE has no objection to proceeding in this court.  Atty Henderson states case is resolved and requests change of plea date.  State does not object to DE's motion to modify bond to allow DE to enter into the Vivitrol Program.  Upon hearing statements motion is granted.  Bond shall be modified to a $2000 Signature bond there shall be no consumption of alcohol or drugs without a prescription and DE shall comply with the Vivitrol Program; all other prior conditions of bond continue.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Gordie Boucher Ford 8301 75th St in Pleasant Prairie, Ross R, or Belal I B.  Comply with the Vivitrol Program.  No consumption of alcohol or drugs unless prescribed.
To Modify Bond
Submitted by Atty Grant Henderson
from the court regarding rotation
Final pre-trial on July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard A. Fliess in court, in custody.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE still believes Atty Henderson from Racine PD is being appointed for him although no notice has been filed.     DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

110PM    Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on April 22, 2022 at 08:15 am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond continued as previously set.  SPD going to appt. Atty Henderson - time previously waived by DE.  ts

Defendant Richard A. Fliess in court, in custody.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agree to represent this applicant.
